answerText: Jean Baptise Joseph Fourier[10] Fourier transforms change functions into sines and cosines. In cylindrical coordinates, the Hankel transform relates a function as a series of these functions. Thus they are the basis function of cylindrical coordinates.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | Finals 2 | 21 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This scientist names a law that relates heat flux to the temperature gradient. For 10 points each: [10] Name this scientist who names a type of transform.
